abstract: Organizers of Indonesia's annual Ubud Writers and Readers Festival are ordered to cancel several events as authorities seek to avoid controversy over 50th anniversary on mass killings of alleged communists in mid-1960s.
lead_paragraph: Days before the Ubud Writers and Readers Festival, local authorities ordered organizers to cancel events related to the killings of a half-million people in the mid-1960s.

headline.main: At a Bali Festival, Indonesia Enforces a Silence About Its Bloody Past
headline.print_headline: Enforcing Silence About Indonesia’s Bloody Past

snippet: Days before the Ubud Writers and Readers Festival, local authorities ordered organizers to cancel events related to the killings of a half-million people in the mid-1960s.
